NAME.Nominative: Martyrs Acyndinos, Pegasias, Aphthonios, Elpidiphoros, Anempodistus and 7,000 suffering with them in Persia (c.341-345)

SAINT.LIFE: They suffered for Christ in Persia during the reign of Shapur II in about the year 345. Sts. Acindynus, Pegasius and Anempodistus served at the imperial court. After various and horrible torments they were burnt. St. Afton, a warrior, and Elpidephorus, the imperial grandee, who criticized the Shah for the innocent persecution of Christians, were beheaded. Together with these Holy Martyrs up to 7000 Christians were beheaded.

LITURGY.TROPARION: Blessed is the earth that was filled with your blood, O Passion-bearers of the Lord, and holy are the dwelling places that received your bodies. For you triumphed over the enemy in the stadium, and preached Christ with courage. We pray that you beseech Him, since He is Good, that our souls may be saved.

LITURGY.KONTAKION: Thou hast received into the enjoyment of Thy goodness and repose, O only Blessed One, the pious and God-bearing martyrs, Who have abandoned all earthly goods, Acindynus, Pegasius, Anempodistus, together with them, Afton and Elpidephorus, O Only Most Blessed.
